title: How to Dress for Swing Dancing

steps.title: Keep it casual for class and practice.
steps.content: Keep it casual for class and practice. Swing is a relaxed dance, and there is no dress code for it unless there is a theme. [1] X Expert Source Bridgette Borzillo Dance Instructor & Artistic Director Expert Interview. 10 September 2021. If you're just going to practice or class, there's no reason to dress up. Dressy clothes can be stuffy and limit movement, so they're best saved for formal occasions. At practice or class, you do not want to limit your mobility. You want to be able to move as much as possible to get the moves down.

steps.title: Wear a blouse with high-waisted shorts or pants.
steps.content: Wear a blouse with high-waisted shorts or pants. Keep the blouse light, as lighter materials will gather less sweat. Opt for shorts or pants that are also made out of lighter materials. High-waisted shorts and pants have a vintage feel that allow you to encapsulate the traditional feel of swing dancing without sacrificing comfort during practice. [2] X Research source Comfort is the most important thing, so choose shorts and pants that fit you well and that you can move around in. If you don't want to wear a blouse, a light t-shirt can also work.

steps.title: Wear a light shirt with full-length pants.
steps.content: Wear a light shirt with full-length pants. With men, it's considered traditional to wear full-length pants to swing dancing. There can be many turns, jumps, and tricks in the dance, so long pants are suitable. [3] X Expert Source Bridgette Borzillo Dance Instructor & Artistic Director Expert Interview. 10 September 2021. If you prefer shorts, that should be okay for practice, but comfortable pants are considered more in adherence with tradition. You should pair your pants with a light shirt that you can move around in. Pick pants that fit you well and are comfortable. This is important for swing dancing practice.

steps.title: Bring an extra shirt.
steps.content: Bring an extra shirt. You will get a little sweaty during swing dancing practice. It's a good idea to bring some extra clothes. Have an extra shirt on hand going into swing dancing lessons.

steps.title: Wear a vintage dress.
steps.content: Wear a vintage dress. A vintage dress is a classic swing dancing look that works great for more formal swing dancing events. Swing dancing was prominent in the 1940s and '50s. Many people like to wear clothing belonging to those times to feel like they are in the time when it originated. [4] X Expert Source Bridgette Borzillo Dance Instructor & Artistic Director Expert Interview. 10 September 2021. You can try to pick a dress fitting with this era. [5] X Research source In the '40s, dresses usually had fitted tops and collars with an a-line skirt. Button-down dresses were particularly popular, as were colors like black and navy blue. In the '50s, full, long skirts were often paired with tighter tops. Tops usually had a halter neck and skirts ended around mid-shin. Dresses were more colorful and often had prints like flowers. You can look for a vintage dress online or at a local secondhand or thrift store. You can also buy a new dress that's cut in a vintage style.

steps.title: Choose a skirt that allows for movement.
steps.content: Choose a skirt that allows for movement. If you decide to wear a skirt and blouse for swing dancing, this can be an acceptable look. However, make sure the skirt you choose is not constricting. Remember, movement is key for successful swing dancing. Skirts should usually be knee length or longer and loose-fitting. Skirts that cling to the body will be constrictive for swing dancing. If you want to wear a more fitted skirt, watch the fabric. If you wear something like a pencil skirt, make sure the fabric has a good stretch so you can move around.

steps.title: Use layers for menswear.
steps.content: Use layers for menswear. Layers can add a touch of formality and fits with the swing dancing style. If you want to wear layers, try some of the following combinations: [6] X Research source Wear a vest over a dress shirt, with a tie, and then throw on a jacket. This look works well for cooler months. For warmer months, you could stick to a vest, tie, and undershirt but lose the jacket. If it's very warm out, you can still layer for formality. Hold up a pair of dress pants with suspenders and wear an undershirt and tie.

steps.title: Wear a suit for very formal occasions.
steps.content: Wear a suit for very formal occasions. If you want to go very formal, wear a suit. Traditionally, a double-breasted suit in worn for swing-dancing. This can work great for very formal occasions, such as a date night or a formal swing dance competition. Go for a suit with a slightly old fashioned, vintage feel. Wear a suit jacket with broad shoulders. Opt for wider neckties or bow-ties. The pants you wear with your suit should be high waisted.

steps.title: Pick shoes that are comfortable.
steps.content: Pick shoes that are comfortable. Above anything else, select shoes that are comfortable to wear. This is particularly important if you are selecting shoes for practice. Simple sneakers work best for both men and women who are just starting out swing dancing. [7] X Expert Source Bridgette Borzillo Dance Instructor & Artistic Director Expert Interview. 10 September 2021.

steps.title: Opt for leather soles.
steps.content: Opt for leather soles. Suede bottom dance shoes are ideal for swing dancing. [8] X Expert Source Bridgette Borzillo Dance Instructor & Artistic Director Expert Interview. 10 September 2021. Leather soles are important for being able to slide and turn easily on the dance floor - too much grip or resistance on the soles can cause tension in your knees when you twist, making 'repetitive strain' knee injuries likely. When selecting dance shoes, opt for shoes with leather soles either built in or added. [9] X Research source Find things like boots, dress shoes, and loafers with leather soles for menswear. For women's wear, it may be difficult to find heels with leather soles. However, you can try flats, tennis shoes, or boots with leather soles.

steps.title: Stay away from heels until you're experienced.
steps.content: Stay away from heels until you're experienced. Heels can be a great formal touch for dressier events. A mild heel is fine for dancing if you're experienced. Once you get comfortable swing dancing, it's okay to wear heels. However, until you feel like you have control when dancing, hold off on the heels. [10] X Research source If you're unsure when it's safe for you to wear heels, talk it over with your dance instructor.

steps.title: Purchase dance shoes if you swing dance frequently.
steps.content: Purchase dance shoes if you swing dance frequently. If you're serious about swing dancing, find a dance store in your area and talk to a worker about purchasing dance shoes. A professional should be able to help you find shoes catered for your specific feet, style, and goals as a dancer. If you're going to be swing dancing frequently, dance shoes will hold up longer than regular shoes. [11] X Research source
